subject: Re: Samba 3.0.25a Available for Download
body:
On Mon, 2007-05-28 at 20:19 -0400, derrell.lipman@unwireduniverse.com
wrote:
> simo  writes:
> 
> > On Mon, 2007-05-28 at 19:42 -0400, derrell.lipman@unwireduniverse.com
> > wrote:
> >> "Gerald (Jerry) Carter"  writes:
> >> 
> >> > ================
> >> > Download Details
> >> > ================
> >> >
> >> > The uncompressed tarballs and patch files have been signed
> >> > using GnuPG (ID 6568B7EA).  The source code can be downloaded
> >> > from:
> >> >
> >> > 	http://download.samba.org/samba/ftp/
> >> >
> >> > The release notes are available online at:
> >> >
> >> > 	http://www.samba.org/samba/history/samba-3.0.25a.html
> >> >
> >> > Binary packages are available at
> >> >
> >> > 	http://download.samba.org/samba/ftp/Binary_Packages/
> >> 
> >> Hi Jerry,
> >> 
> >> In case this was an oversight...  I just noticed that there are no
> >> 3.0.25a binaries in the Debian subdirectory of Binary_Packages.
> >
> > Derrel, right, I build them but had no time till now.
> > Going to build them up an ship.
> 
> Ok.  They are available in the Debian "unstable" distribution now, if
> you want to just "steal" them instead.

No, I release explicitly for older stable versions.
I am building sarge packages.

If I can I will try to build for ecth when 3.0.26 is out and make a last
build for sarge. If I have no time I will simply retire the backports or
see if someone else have time to do it and voluneers.

Simo.

-- 
Simo Sorce
Samba Team GPL Compliance Officer
email: idra@samba.org
http://samba.org
